sense.name: state of understanding, enlightenment
sense.commentary: COMPREHENSION[+state][+internal][+understanding] Note: refers to an actor/sgent having an understanding of something
sense.examples: These drills will improve your listening comprehension in French. John has only a weak comprehension of information entropy. They had no comprehension of what he was trying to achieve.

sense.name: state of inclusion or involvement
sense.commentary: COMPREHENSION[+state][+external][+involvement][+inclusion] Note: refers to a range of things being part of an included set
sense.examples: The comprehension of every delegate's proposal was not possible. This insurance policy's comprehension is greater than that one's.
